hotspots.hotspot:
Chernobyl nuclear power plant disaster:

  • Explosion and fire in 1986
  • Radioactive contamination released into the atmosphere
  • Contamination spread over the USSR and Europe
  • High levels of cancer and genetic defects occurred

Fukushima-Daiichi nuclear power facility disaster:

  • Offshore earthquake and tsunami in 2011
  • Earthquakes caused reactors to shut down automatically
  • Tsunami prevented the generators from cooling the reactors
  • Overheating resulted in radiation release

Air pollution is one of the most common types of pollution caused by human.
The Three Gorges Dam in China was built to generate hydroelectricity, but it also caused downstream flooding.
The Exxon Valdez oil spill caused significant loss of life to animal populations when more than 700,00 barrels of oil spread throughout the Gulf of Mexico.
The nuclear power plant accident at Three Mile Island in Pennsylvania led to sweeping reforms in nuclear power plant operations in the United States.
